channel.title: Abuse on a child stops ADD?
channel.description:
Well I was thinking that usually if you beat a child, he/she wouldn't do whatever he/she got punished for.
So if a child with ADD got repeatedly beaten, would straighten out his/her disorder.
Just a theory and wouldn't get man anywhere.
I'm pretty sure this belongs in Discussions&Debates but I'm not sure ;)

item.title: Abuse on a child stops ADD?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:15, topic:286949”][quote author=jme link=topic=379469.msg2856299#msg2856299 date=1246890457]

Hitting them too hard isn’t good, but giving them a decent punch when they deserve it should be allowed.

I wouldn’t punch a child. I meant a light slap or something.
[/quote]
Gimme your yes/no’s I’ve had all these done to me.

Locked out of house
Locked out of car left on highway
Punching
Slapping
Hair Pulling
Biting
Clawing
Cutting off hair
Kicking[/quote]

Locked out of house
Locked out of car left on highway
Punching
Slapping
Hair Pulling
Biting
Clawing
Cutting off hair
Kicking

I’ve had all of those done to me… Only had my hair pulled when I had me hair forcfully cut off… bitch…

item.title: Abuse on a child stops ADD?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

It won’t. My parents beat me/my brother. Does nothing. Generally makes it worse.

EDIT: btw, these starbursts are very good.

Read full topic
item.source: Abuse on a child stops ADD?

item.title: Abuse on a child stops ADD?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Let us consider a second what ‘ADD’ stands for: “Attention deficit disorder”. In other words, somebody isn’t paying attention to what you want them to. In a very general sense, people pay attention to two things: Things they find interesting, and things that are relevant to a problem they’re trying to fix. Everything else is considered boring or unimportant. I was previously diagnosed with ADD and all other kinds of mental disorders. But the people who diagnosed me were trying to get me to pay attention to things that had no relevancy to my interests or fixed any of my problems. It isn’t a “disorder” or “deficiency” whatsoever, it is merely bad instruction.

Unforunately, most people don’t have such strong interests that if you try to make them pay attention to something unrelated, they will refuse.

Read full topic
item.source: Abuse on a child stops ADD?

item.title: Abuse on a child stops ADD?
item.dc:creator: @The_Flames The_Flames
item.description:
@The_Flames wrote:

Lothy:

It worked pretty well on Ned Flanders… Perhaps too well.

No that’s called spending too much time properly believing that if you do things good in life you’ll go to heaven.

And I severely doubt it, I mean its a mental disability and the person getting smacked (hit, beat, whatever) will most likely be mentally intact (i.e. it wouldn’t have much of an effect on their minds).

And who says smacking makes a kid not do whatever they where punished for again, no proof to be honest and as far as I’m aware it never did anyone I know any good :rolleyes:

Read full topic
